ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What will convey to you what the Crashing Blow is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: How will you comprehend what the startling calamity is? --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And what do you know what the Calamity is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Would that you knew what the crash is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And what have you understood, what the event that terrifies the hearts is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And what will make you know what Al-Qari`ah is
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And what will make you comprehend what the terrible calamity is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And what shall teach thee what is the Clatterer?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Calamity is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Would that you knew what the Clatterer is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: What shall Make thee know that which the Striking is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: What will show you what is the Catastrophe?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And what will explain to thee what the (Day) of Noise and Clamour is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And what will make you know what the striking (Hour) is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What shall let you know what the Clatterer is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: What will explain to you what the Shocker is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [101:3] And what will show you, [what] will make known to you, what the Clattering Blow is? — additional emphasis of its awesomeness (the first mā is a subject, and what follows it is its predicate; the second mā and its predicate also function together as the second direct object of [the verb] adrā, ‘show’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Ah, what will convey unto thee) O Muhammad (what the Calamity is!) he said this to show its tremendousness.
